text: ninh hi everyone Anthony Fantana here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new off
record wasted years this is the latest
full-length LP from California hardcore
punk outfit off a band that is pretty
much infamous for its throwback punk
rock sound a sound that literally works
off the blueprint of Black Flag's
nervous breakdown 7-inch an early
release from the hardcore punk outfit
which the lead singer of off Keith
Morris was on in the short span of time
in which he fronted the band Black Flag
then he actually went on to Front Circle
Jerks and the other members of offer
seasoned vets as well bring experience
and connections to seminal acts in punk
rock or just underground rock in general
and to be completely honest while yeah
this record this band is a bit of a
throwback I don't really mind this
flavor of punk rock coming back
especially since I think the sound of
the nervous breakdown EP as well as a
lot of the tracks from the first four
years compilation from Black Flag had a
lot more potential than they were
actually given in the short amount of
time that these songs were made the
return of the sound was it's had an offs
debut first four EPS back in 2010
release that was a fantastic
continuation of these old hardcore punk
tropes except with more clarity more
composure I think more maturity too but
in a good way
it's like at this point hardcore punk
finally has the experience and the
knowledge to justify the incredible
anger it's always harbored for all these
years and it's hard for me to boy them I
love this record down to nostalgia
considering how well this sound is being
performed on this thing not only that
but a lot of the issues addressed in the
lyrics feel pretty current
now when off came back with a
self-titled record in 2012 it was a bit
of a redo the same sound a lot of the
same aesthetics although a little less
impressive because of the redundancy and
sound and every
in comparison with their last album and
on top of that the mix on this thing was
slightly out of whack the guitars and
the vocals just kind of felt out of
proportion
however these mixing issues seem to have
been fixed on this latest release from
off wasted years there's a lot more
instrumental balance on this LP although
in comparison with previous releases I
would say it's a tad heavier but outside
of that offf style really hasn't changed
in any significant kind of way they are
still delivering high-octane punk rock
with a vintage flare that couldn't be
more convincing if they haven't
impressed you yet with their previous
releases chances are they're not going
to be impressing you with this one and
if they have been impressing you I guess
the question is how long can they
continue doing it as they seem to just
be kind of repeating themselves for me
personally as long as off continues to
do this sound well and do it justice
they will most likely have my ear in
some capacity and for me doing the style
of music well means memorable riffs it
means visceral performances
it means hearing Keith Morris's
uncompromising ly angry and socially
aware lyrics as indebted to the Past as
they are I think off makes really
captivating punk rock music with an
infectious energy punchy messages and
relatively short song lengths as far as
what these songs are about I'm loving a
lot of what off brings to the table like
being voted out by the powers that be
being broken down ground up in the land
of the free it's moments like this where
Keith Morrison's incredible sarcasm as
he recites patriotic lines like this
that really makes the track same goes
for the track red white and black where
the lyrics address things like your
possessions being repossessed and
surveillance or the song all I can grab
which is a track about extreme greed or
over our heads which seems to be a track
about the imperialistic wars that are
being waged right now as I mentioned
before the riffs on this thing a lot of
power chords they're pretty speedy every
once in a while off really changes up
the pace by doing a slower riff
maybe you break down something a bit
heavier a bit more menacing like on the
track no easy escape everyone
while there's a chaotic guitar solo or a
bright wailing guitar lead so yeah there
is a very slight degree of variety on
this LP but it's just 23 minutes of
incredibly fast aggressive socially
aware music so it does tend to run a
little homogeneous and maybe this
becomes more apparent when some of the
lyrics on these tracks aren't that
gripping because then all that you
really have to ride on are the riffs
which tend to sound similar to other
riffs on this very album like Legion of
evil or wasted years the title track on
this thing and the similarities run even
deeper when comparing these tracks to
songs that off.have release on their
previous records if there's more than
one way to skin this cat off is
certainly not interested in finding out
about it they definitely flirt with that
idea on the track you must be damned
which is one minute and 50 seconds long
which is almost like progressive rock
length for off and generally a lot of
the songs on this LP are longer than
tracks on previous releases they're not
a single song on this record that dips
under the 1 minute mark
however these longer songs and this
extra effort on this record doesn't
really add up into any meteor or more
detailed songs any increase in ambition
and the songwriting style that off
brings to the table off does not use
this time to make their hooks stickier
off doesn't use this time to add any
real major surprises into this record I
can't say I'm disappointed because I did
get what I expected from off I got a
good hardcore punk record however I feel
like off is at a point where they have
proven that yes they've resurrected the
hardcore monster it's back from the dead
however I feel that well why not
experiment with it a bit without
completely bastardizing it and
continuing to do the genre justice or at
least change up the riffs or add more
melodies things that are going to make
these songs feel distinct from other
songs the band has previously recorded
if any group is capable of doing either
of these two things it is off I have
complete faith in their ability to go
down that road if they so choose to but
as of right now I'm just kind of feeling
a decent too strong 7 on this new LP of
theirs
transition if you've given this LP
listen what did you think of it did you
love it
did you hate it why what do you think I
should review next and that's it
Anthony Fantana off wasted years forever
